topic.title: Providing additional documentation for XML elements and attributes

body.p: The application gathers from the associated schemas (DTDs, XML Schema, RelaxNG) and presents documentation for each element or attribute. For example if you open the Content Completion Window for a recognized XML vocabulary you will see for each element documentation provided by the schema which is associated with it. Similar information is shown when you hover the mouse pointer over tag names presented in the Elements view. If you hover over attributes in the Attributes view you will also get information about what each attribute does gathered from the same schema information.

If you have a document type configuration set up for your XML vocabulary, there is a special XML configuration file which can be added that provides additional documentation information or links to specification web pages for certain elements and attributes. The following steps should be taken in order to provide this additional information:
Create a new folder in your document type's configuration directory like for example: OXYGEN_INSTALL_DIR/frameworks/dita/styleguide.
From the application Document Type Association preferences page edit the document type configuration for your XML vocabulary and in the Classpath tab add a link to the newly created folder.
Use the New dialog wizard to create a file using the new file template Oxygen content completion styleguide.
Make the proper changes to your custom mapping file. As examples you can look at how the DITA mapping file is configured: OXYGEN_INSTALL_DIR/frameworks/dita/styleguide/contentCompletionElementsMap.xml. The associated XML Schema contains additional details about how each element and attribute should be used in the mapping file.
Save the file using the fixed name contentCompletionElementsMap.xml in the newly created folder.
Reopen the application and open an XML document, in the Content Completion Window you should see the additional annotations for each element.
